metadata.title: CVE-2020-12888 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
The VFIO PCI driver in the Linux kernel through 5.6.13 mishandles attemptsto access disabled memory space.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-12888` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-118-generic - 4.15.0-118.119~16.04.1
linux-image-4.15.0-118-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-118.119~16.04.1
linux-image-4.15.0-118-lowlatency - 4.15.0-118.119~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-118-generic - 4.15.0-118.119~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-118-lowlatency - 4.15.0-118.119~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1083-aws - 4.15.0-1083.87~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1096-azure - 4.15.0-1096.106~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1084-gcp - 4.15.0-1084.95~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1054-oracle - 4.15.0-1054.58~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1074-fips - 4.4.0-1074.80
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1074-fips - 4.4.0-1074.80
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-1074-fips - 4.4.0-1074.80
linux-image-unsigned-hmac-4.4.0-1074-fips - 4.4.0-1074.80
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro
